caption: OMG please change your name this is nothing like the real Sir Chicken opened in 89 on the west side over priced so you guys know legs an thighs are the cheapest cut of the chicken the real Sir chicken gave you a quarter chicken boatload of fries for$1.50 for 25 years
The honey butter sandwich is now my favorite! So juicy tender and seasoned just right. There are other chicken sandwiches yeah sure but not like Sir Chicken! They're doing something right!!

There are a ton of fried chicken places around Chicago, but it’s definitely a contender. Portion is nice, the coleslaw allows for a nice tang to the spicy chicken. The pickled cherry peppers gives a nice bitter bite to the whole sandwich.  Just spicy enough.  If you have your usual fried chicken spot in the city, give it a break and add this spot to you list. Might even become the “other” option in your rotation of restaurants.

Checked out the Sir Chicken pop up at Perilla and I must say the hot and spicy chicken sando was excellent. 2 large tenders with coleslaw and peppers on a bun along with their fries and homemade cheese sauce made it a worthy contender for one of the best in Chicago. Can't wait to try more when I return!

Stop searching all over for your fried chicken craving- this is THE spot to go when your in chicago! Heated outdoor patio, awesome cocktail/wine list, great service, even better food- what more can I say?

Western and Santa Monica location still the best spot to go to in Chicago combo 2 extra hot sliders  and Mac and cheese just be ready to wait in line since there always a wait to order even during covid
